Detailed Description

Cycle detector.

This class is the base class used by a TREX agent to traverse all its reactors.

It ensures that a CyclicDependency extception will be thrown if a cyclic dependency is identified during the reactors traversal

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Member Function Documentation

void TREX::agent::CycleDetector::back_edge ( TREX::transaction::graph::relation_type const &  rel,
TREX::transaction::graph const &  g 
) [inline]

back edge callback

This dfs callback is called only when the dfs loops back to a vertex that is still being explored. This clearly idenitfy a loop in the graph wwhich is a proof of cyclic dependncy betwee two reactors

Exceptions:
CycleDetected always thrown as this call indicates a cyclic dependency in the egent graph

bool TREX::agent::CycleDetector::is_valid ( TREX::transaction::graph::reactor_id  r  )  const [inline, protected]

Check for node validity.

Parameters:
[in] r A reactor reference

Check that r referes to an exisiting reactor. This method is used during graph traversal to vcheck that the an edge is not pointing to nothing

Return values:
true if r refers to a reactor
false otherwise
See also:
TREX::transaction::garph::null_reactor()
